whatIs.heading: What Is a Payday Loan?
whatIs.content:
A payday loan is a small-dollar, short-term loan designed to help you cover unexpected expenses until your next paycheck. Unlike traditional bank loans that can take weeks to process, payday loans offer quick approval decisions and fast funding - often the same day you apply.

Payday loans typically range from $100 to $1,000, depending on your state and income. They're designed to be repaid in full on your next payday, usually within 2-4 weeks. This makes them ideal for temporary cash needs rather than long-term borrowing.

The application process is simple and straightforward. You can apply online from home or visit one of our convenient store locations. Most applicants receive a decision within minutes, and if approved, funds can be deposited directly to your bank account or picked up in cash at a store.

whenToUse.heading: When Should You Consider a Payday Loan?
whenToUse.intro: Payday loans are designed for short-term financial emergencies. They can help when you need cash quickly and can repay it on your next payday.
situations: Unexpected car repairs that prevent you from getting to work
Emergency medical or dental expenses not covered by insurance
Utility bills that need immediate payment to avoid disconnection
Essential home repairs that can't wait
Covering bills when a paycheck is delayed or short

costs.heading: Understanding Payday Loan Costs
costs.content:
Payday loans have fees that vary by state and loan amount. Fees typically range from $10 to $30 for every $100 borrowed. For example, if you borrow $300 with a $15 per $100 fee, you would repay $345 on your due date.

We believe in complete transparency. Before you accept any loan, we clearly disclose all fees, the total amount you'll repay, and your due date. There are no hidden charges or surprise fees.

While payday loans have higher costs than traditional bank loans, they provide value through speed, convenience, and accessibility that banks often can't match. For short-term emergencies, the cost may be worth the peace of mind.
costs.disclaimer: Rates and terms vary by state. Not all consumers will qualify for the maximum loan amount.

faq.question: How much can I borrow with a payday loan?
faq.answer: Payday loan amounts typically range from $100 to $1,000, depending on your state's regulations and your income. First-time borrowers may qualify for smaller amounts initially, with higher limits available after establishing a positive repayment history.

faq.question: How quickly can I get my money?
faq.answer: If you apply in-store and are approved, you can leave with cash in hand. For online applications, same-day instant funding to your debit card is available in many cases. Standard direct deposit typically arrives the next business day.

faq.question: Do you check my credit score?
faq.answer: We do not perform a traditional hard credit check that affects your FICO score. We may use alternative credit reporting agencies to verify your identity and review your application, but this won't impact your traditional credit score.

faq.question: What if I can't repay my payday loan on time?
faq.answer: If you're having difficulty repaying, contact us before your due date. Depending on your state, you may have options like payment plans or extensions. Note that late payments may result in additional fees and could affect your future borrowing.

faq.question: Can I pay off my payday loan early?
faq.answer: Yes, you can repay your loan early at any time without penalty. Paying early may save you money on fees depending on your loan terms and state regulations.

faq.question: Is my personal information safe?
faq.answer: Absolutely. We use industry-standard encryption and security measures to protect your personal and financial information. We never sell your data to third parties.

whatIs.heading: What Is an Installment Loan?
whatIs.content:
An installment loan is a personal loan that you repay over time through scheduled monthly payments (installments). Unlike payday loans that are due in full on your next payday, installment loans give you several months or even years to repay, making each payment more affordable.

Installment loans offer larger borrowing amounts than payday loans - typically from $500 to $5,000 or more depending on your state and financial situation. This makes them suitable for bigger expenses like major car repairs, medical bills, or debt consolidation.

Each monthly payment includes a portion of the principal plus interest, and the amount stays the same throughout the loan term. This predictability makes budgeting easier. Plus, there's no penalty for paying off your loan early.

faq.answer: The main difference is repayment. Payday loans are repaid in one lump sum on your next payday, while installment loans are repaid over time through multiple scheduled payments. Installment loans also typically offer larger amounts.

faq.question: What can I use an installment loan for?
faq.answer: You can use an installment loan for virtually any purpose including car repairs, medical expenses, home improvements, debt consolidation, or unexpected bills.

faq.question: Will an installment loan affect my credit score?
faq.answer: It depends on the lender. Some lenders report payment history to credit bureaus, which means on-time payments could help your credit. Late payments could hurt it. We'll disclose our reporting practices when you apply.

whatIs.heading: What Is a Title Loan?
whatIs.content:
A title loan is a secured loan that uses your vehicle's title as collateral. Because your car backs the loan, you can typically borrow more money than with an unsecured payday loan. Title loans are ideal when you need a larger amount of cash and have a vehicle with equity.

To qualify, you must own your vehicle outright or have significant equity in it. You'll bring your car and its title to our location for an assessment. Based on your vehicle's value and your ability to repay, we'll make a loan offer.

The best part? You keep driving your car while repaying the loan. We simply hold the title as security until you've paid off the balance in full.

faq.question: How much can I borrow with a title loan?
faq.answer: Title loan amounts depend on your vehicle's value, typically ranging from 25% to 50% of the car's worth. Loans can range from a few hundred to $10,000 or more depending on your vehicle and state regulations.

faq.question: Do I get to keep my car?
faq.answer: Yes, you continue to drive your vehicle throughout the loan period. We only hold the title as collateral. Once you repay the loan in full, the title is returned to you.

faq.question: What happens if I can't repay my title loan?
faq.answer: Contact us immediately if you're having trouble making payments. We may be able to work out a modified payment plan. However, failure to repay could ultimately result in vehicle repossession, so borrow only what you can afford.

faq.question: What types of vehicles qualify?
faq.answer: Most cars, trucks, SUVs, and motorcycles can qualify for title loans. The vehicle must have a clear title in your name and meet our minimum value requirements.
